bibl.title: Named Letter-Carriers among the Oxyrhynchus Papyri
bibl.note: Analyses the role played by named letter-carriers among Greek personal letters in the Oxyrhynchus papyri as possible background for Pauline practice, and within the context of recent proposals concerning the role of the letter-carriers within Pauline practice. Around forty letters are discussed, with three examples analysed in more depth (P. Oxy. I, 113; XLVI, 3313; XLIX, 3505).
bibl.seg: HEAD Peter M., Named Letter-Carriers among the Oxyrhynchus Papyri.
Journal for the Study of the New Testament 31 (2009) pp. 279-299.

Analyses the role played by named letter-carriers among Greek personal letters in the Oxyrhynchus papyri as possible background for Pauline practice, and within the context of recent proposals concerning the role of the letter-carriers within Pauline practice. Around forty letters are discussed, with three examples analysed in more depth (P. Oxy. I, 113; XLVI, 3313; XLIX, 3505).
